title: Three Sum
algorithmDescription: Find all unique triplets that sum to zero using sorting and two pointers
detailedDescription: Find all unique triplets [a, b, c] where a + b + c = 0. Input: First line has n. Second line has n integers. Output: All unique triplets (one per line). Sort array first, then for each element, use two pointers to find pairs summing to its negative.
hints: Fix first element, use two pointers for remaining two
Skip duplicates to avoid duplicate triplets
Two pointers converge based on sum comparison
solutionApproach: Sort array. For each i from 0 to n-3: target = -nums[i]. Use two pointers (left=i+1, right=n-1) to find pairs summing to target. Skip duplicates for all three positions.
testCaseCriteria: Must find all unique triplets in O(n²) time. No duplicate triplets in output.
